result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifton R. Metcalf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Defendant appeared, but had to leave to go to work prior to case being called.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Arguments heard regarding restitution amount.  Court sets restitution at $0.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Clifton R. Metcalf in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5  YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2  YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to COURT 3, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Restitution to be determined on the next Court date  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  Payment of these Court costs, surcharges and assessments will be determined on the next court date.  
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.  Payment of this fee will be determined on the next Court date.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-No contact with Jerome M, Joy M-M
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court sets a Status as to restitution amount on May 16, 2016

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of 195 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 195 DAYS time served.  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  Payment of these Court costs, surcharges and assessments will be determined on the next court date.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.  Payment of this fee will be determined on the next court date. 

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Clifton R. Metcalf in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY TO counts 1 AND 3.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNTS 1 and 3 as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Clifton R. Metcalf in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant Clifton R. Metcalf in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to personal issues, defense requests adjournment of the currently scheduled jury trial.  Court grants adjournment.  Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Clifton R. Metcalf in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Clifton R. Metcalf in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to counts 2 and 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
